article.headline: Robert Morris 69, Central Conn. 68
article.story: NEW BRITAIN, Conn. (AP) -- Derek Coleman's 3-pointer with 10 seconds to play gave Robert Morris a 69-68 victory over Central Connecticut on Saturday. Coleman's shot extended Robert Morris' winning streak to four game and ended its three-game losing streak to Central. Aaron Thomas led the Colonials (12-10, 9-4 Northeast Conference) with 18 points. Chaz McCrommon had 17 and Maurice Carter and Mark Anderson each scored 10. The Colonials shot 54.2 percent (26-for-48). Justin Chiera had 16 points for Central (9-11, 6-7), which had its four-game winning streak snapped. Ron Robinson had 15 points and Javier Mojica added 13 points and 10 rebounds. Robert Morris was 8-for-11 from the field in taking a 24-12 lead. But Chiera had four 3-pointers over the final 3:24, including one from 25 feet at the halftime buzzer that tied at 37. Robinson scored five points as Central went ahead 50-44 with just under 13 minutes remaining. Central inbounded the ball and called a timeout with 5.4 seconds remaining. Lenny Jefferson then missed a shot in the lane. Robinson's 3-point attempt from the left corner bounced off the rim at the buzzer.
